title: Pokhozhaev's identity
summary: Pokhozhaev's identity is an integral relation satisfied by stationary localized solutions to a nonlinear Schrödinger equation or nonlinear Klein–Gordon equation. It was obtained by S.I. Pokhozhaev[1] and is similar to the virial theorem. This relation is also known as D.H. Derrick's theorem. Similar identities can be derived for other equations of mathematical physics.
